data.title: Lady Antonia Fraser: queen of weddings
data.meta_description: You might expect Lady Antonia Fraser to know a thing or two about weddings. Unlike most of us, who take a leading role in perhaps three or four weddings in our lives, she has been twice a bride and
data.text:
You might expect Lady Antonia Fraser to know a thing or two about weddings. Unlike most of us, who take a leading role in perhaps three or four weddings in our lives, she has been twice a bride and seven times the mother of bride or groom. And having followed every royal wedding since 1947, when she was one of the cheering crowd in the Mall who thronged the palace gates, she is riveted by every detail of the forthcoming royal wedding.

In this respect there was a gulf between herself and her late husband Harold Pinter. In July 1981, she was hired by CBS to comment on the wedding of Charles and Diana. That evening she and her husband went out to dine. Pinter
